name: places/ChIJ5QDpE_v3wokRwqi6_AG6BsM
adrFormatAddress: 3750 Broadway, New York, NY 10032-1525, USA

originalText.text: Just like the original location on 116th, this location doesn't disappoint. It's actually bigger, super bright and welcoming and the staff are just as great as the original location. Don't be fooled, the possibilities are endless and I highly recommend you check the menu first before you come in because there's just so many ways to make a good bagel. No matter what you choose, it's going to be good. Totally recommend the Andrew, Bo's El Barrio and the Bo's Chopped Cheese.

originalText.text:
This is definitely a bagel shop that Harlem needs, but the neighborhood deserves so much better.

The quality of the bagels and sandwiches is there. The bagels are all well-coated in toppings, have a distinct and standalone “bagel” flavor, and offer a satisfyingly crusty shell to chew with every bite.

The staff is super friendly and the store is clean and spacious, albeit without a unique aesthetic other than “black and white minimalist”. The menu is extensive and, at least for its soft-opening, offers many different items that make me say “oh, I need to come back for that!” before my order is even ready.

I’ve been dying for a true bagel shop in the neighborhood ever since I moved here and I can confidently say I’ll be a regular at Bo’s. However, it will be out of convenience rather than genuine desire.

The menu is incredibly overpriced by bagel shop standards. A BEC ran me $11. An everything bagel with plain CC and a black coffee was also $11. Plus, I’m 99% sure they use Philadelphia cream cheese as their base, judging by the Kraft-branded box out in the open on the counter. I can’t speak for how other bagel shops prepare their schmears but to know, outright, that I’m eating the same thing I could get at the grocery store, only now with a sprinkle of chives mixed in, makes me question not only the prices but their commitment to the craft.

I support paying for a better product when you have the chance. And, when it comes to breakfast/bagel spots — with hundreds to choose from across the city — I take it seriously. While the bagels at Bo’s are really good, you can find similar (if not better) bagels just by throwing a dart at a map in New York. The bagels are a very average size, as well, so it’s not even a matter of ‘paying for more.’ On the BEC, you get three skinny strips of bacon that resemble what you get from Oscar Meyer.

I am happy and significantly relieved to know I have a real bagel shop just 5 mins from my apartment. This place will make WFH days infinitely better, especially now that I have resigned my lease. I appreciate Bo’s Bagels opening this location, full stop.

There are few things in life I love more than a bagel, some cream cheese, and a cuppa’ black coffee to start the day. But as the saying goes, sometimes love is not enough. And there is not enough at Bo’s to make me “love” it quite yet.

originalText.text:
I couldn’t believe my good fortune when I learned that Bo’s Bagels was opening a location a mere 10 minute walk from my home. I frequented the 116th St location when I lived on 112th and even after moving to Sugar Hill I made the trip to Bo’s for bagels from time to time. The new location is close enough to enable me to be a regular again. You simply cannot find better bagels anywhere. I’m an everything bagel fan and these are perfection. They have salt. You can’t call a bagel without salt an everything. I digress.

The bagels have a really nice crust and are chewy inside. They have all of the flavors you would expect and some unique flavors like Za’atar. The service? Always wonderful. Ashley and Andrew, thanks for saving us from this bagel desert. So happy you are here.

(Please forgive the pics. It was rainy and I wanted to dig into one of those everythings!).

originalText.text: This is a lovely bagel spot and if I lived nearby I would definitely be stopping by daily. I love the selection of cream cheeses as well as their egg bagel sandwiches for a heartier meal.

text.text: This is a lovely bagel spot and if I lived nearby I would definitely be stopping by daily. I love the selection of cream cheeses as well as their egg bagel sandwiches for a heartier meal.

originalText.text: Great NYC bagel, toppings cover the bagel, the right size (they also have mini bagels for kids or lighter appetite). Cold brew coffee was great too. Staff is super friendly, perfect neighborhood bagel spot. Our neighborhood was missing exactly this service and they nailed it!! Would add pictures but I ate my food too fast.
